background: What programming languages are you most comfortable using, and why?
Can you describe a coding project you worked on during your studies or in your free time?
How do you approach debugging a piece of code?
What development tools or environments are you familiar with?
Have you ever worked on a team project? What was your role, and what did you learn from it?
Can you explain the concept of object-oriented programming and provide an example?
How do you prioritize your tasks when working on multiple projects?
What do you understand about version control systems, and have you used any?
How do you stay current with new technologies or programming languages?
Can you explain the difference between a stack and a queue?
How do you ensure code quality and maintainability in your projects?
What is your experience with databases, and what types have you used?
Can you provide an example of how you have used algorithms or data structures in your projects?
What excites you most about pursuing a career in software engineering?
technical: What is the difference between a stack and a queue?
Can you explain what a binary tree is and how it differs from a binary search tree?
How do you prevent a race condition in a multithreaded application?
What is the purpose of version control systems, and can you name a few popular ones?
What is a RESTful API, and how does it differ from SOAP?
Can you describe what responsive design is and why it is important in web development?
What is the difference between synchronous and asynchronous programming?
How does garbage collection work in languages like Java or C#?
What are the four main HTTP methods, and what does each one do?
Can you explain the purpose of a build tool in software development?
How would you optimize a slow-running SQL query?
What is a JSON object, and how is it typically used in web applications?
Can you explain the concept of "inheritance" in programming?
situational: Describe a time when you worked on a team project. What was your role, and how did you ensure effective communication?
Can you provide an example of a challenging bug you encountered in your code? How did you go about troubleshooting it?
Tell me about a time when you had to learn a new programming language or framework quickly. What steps did you take to get up to speed?
Imagine you are given a task with a tight deadline but find that you don't fully understand the requirements. What would you do next?
Share an experience where you had to work with someone whose technical skills were not at the same level as yours. How did you handle the situation?
Have you ever received constructive criticism on your code? How did you respond, and what changes did you make as a result?
Describe a project where you had to balance multiple priorities. How did you manage your time and tasks?
Give an example of a situation where you had to advocate for an idea or solution you believed in. What was the outcome?
Tell me about a time when you encountered a disagreement with a teammate regarding a technical solution. How did you resolve it?
Can you provide an example of when you had to debug a system that was working in production? What steps did you take?
Describe a project where you had to consider user experience while designing a solution. What factors did you prioritize?
Tell me about a time you had to collaborate with non-technical stakeholders. How did you ensure their requirements were met?
Share an experience where you had to adapt your work based on feedback from a code review. What specific changes did you implement?
Describe a scenario where you had to implement a feature without having all the necessary documentation. How did you approach it?
Can you recall an experience in which you had to adhere to a coding standard or guideline? What impact did it have on your work?
